greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to write 2*n as p + 2^k + 5^m with p prime and 2^k + 5^m squarefree, where k and m are nonnegative integers.
comment: This has been verified for all n = 2..10^10.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Mixed sums of primes and other terms, in: Additive Number Theory (edited by D. Chudnovsky and G. Chudnovsky), pp. 341-353, Springer, New York, 2010.

Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures on representations involving primes, in: M. Nathanson (ed.), Combinatorial and Additive Number Theory II, Springer Proc. in Math. & Stat., Vol. 220, Springer, Cham, 2017, pp. 279-310. (See also arXiv:1211.1588 [math.NT], 2012-2017.)
example: a(2) = 1 since 2*2 = 2 + 2^0 + 5^0 with 2 prime and 2^0 + 5^0 squarefree.
a(3) = 1 since 2*3 = 3 + 2^1 + 5^0 with 3 prime and 2^1 + 5^0 squarefree.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, May 03 2018
